SpatioloJI

Data (data)

Spatial Object

class SpatioloJI.data.Spatial_Object.Spatioloji(polygons, cell_meta, adata, fov_positions, images=None, image_shapes=None, images_folder=None, img_format='jpg', prefix_img='CellComposite_F', fov_id_column='fov')[source]

Bases: object

A class for managing and analyzing spatial transcriptomics data across multiple fields of view (FOVs).

polygons

DataFrame with polygon data (‘fov’, ‘x_local_px’, ‘y_local_px’, ‘x_global_px’, ‘y_global_px’, ‘cell’)

cell_meta

DataFrame with cell metadata (‘fov’, ‘CenterX_local_px’, ‘CenterY_local_px’, ‘CenterX_global_px’, ‘CenterY_global_px’, ‘cell’, others)

adata

AnnData object containing gene expression data, UMAP, cell types, etc.

fov_positions

DataFrame with global coordinates of FOVs (‘x_global_px’,’y_global_px’)

images

Dict mapping FOV IDs to image arrays

image_shapes

Dict mapping FOV IDs to (width, height)

custom

Dict for any user-defined additional data

get_cells_in_fov(fov_id, fov_column='fov')[source]

Get all cells within a specific FOV.

Return type:

DataFrame

get_polygon_for_cell(cell_id)[source]

Get polygon data for a specific cell.

Return type:

DataFrame

get_image(fov_id)[source]

Get the image for a specific FOV.

Return type:

Optional[ndarray]

Get a summary of the object’s data.

Return type:

Dict[str, any]

Add custom data to the object.

Retrieve custom data from the object.

Save the object to a pickle file.

Load a Spatioloji object from a pickle file.

Get the AnnData object.

Return type:

AnnData

static read_images_from_folder(folder_path, fov_ids, img_format='jpg', prefix_img='CellComposite_F')[source]

Read images for all FOVs from a folder.

Parameters:

  • folder_path (str) – Path to the folder containing images

  • fov_ids (List[str]) – List of FOV IDs to load images for

  • img_format (str) – Image file format extension (e.g., ‘jpg’, ‘png’)

  • prefix_img (str) – Prefix for image filenames (e.g., ‘CellComposite_F’)

Returns:

  • Dictionary mapping FOV IDs to image arrays

  • Dictionary mapping FOV IDs to image shapes (width, height)

Return type:

Tuple containing

static from_files(polygons_path, cell_meta_path, adata_path, fov_positions_path, images_folder=None, img_format='jpg', prefix_img='CellComposite_F', fov_id_column='fov')[source]

Create a Spatioloji object from file paths.

Parameters:

  • polygons_path (str) – Path to CSV file with polygon data

  • cell_meta_path (str) – Path to CSV file with cell metadata

  • adata_path (str) – Path to h5ad file with gene expression data

  • fov_positions_path (str) – Path to CSV file with FOV positions

  • images_folder (str) – Optional path to folder containing FOV images

  • img_format (str) – Image file format extension (default: ‘jpg’)

  • prefix_img (str) – Prefix for image filenames (default: ‘CellComposite_F’)

  • fov_id_column (str) – Column name for FOV IDs in fov_positions (default: ‘fov’)

Return type:

Spatioloji

Returns:

A new Spatioloji object

class SpatioloJI.data.Spatial_Object.Spatioloji_qc(expr_matrix=None, cell_metadata=None, output_dir='./output/')[source]

Bases: object

A class for handling spatial transcriptomics data analysis and quality control.

Load data from files.

Parameters:

expr_matrix_pathstr

Path to expression matrix file

cell_metadata_pathstr

Path to cell metadata file

prepare_anndata()[source]

Create AnnData object from expression matrix and prepare it for QC.

grubbs_test(data, alpha=0.05)[source]

Perform Grubbs test to detect outliers.

Parameters:

dataarray-like

Data to test for outliers

alphafloat

Significance level

Returns:

int

Index of outlier or -1 if no outlier detected

Parameters:

alphafloat

Significance level for outlier detection

Perform QC on cell area.

Parameters:

alphafloat

Significance level for outlier detection

Perform QC on cell-level metrics.

pandas.DataFrame

Perform QC on FOV-level metrics.

filter_genes()[source]

Filter genes based on expression compared to negative probes.

pandas.DataFrame
